description: MCQ questions for Idioms - Exercise B from textbook

questions.question:
Rahul felt that the time had come for him to take the bull by the horns.

'Take the bull by the horns' means:
options: tame the bull by holding its horns

questions.question:
The students had no other alternative; they had to face the music.

'Face the music' means:
options: face the consequences of one's actions
questions.answer: face the consequences of one's actions

questions.question:
He does not take a walk in the garden; neither does he allow anybody else to do so. He has a dog in the manger attitude.

'A dog in the manger' means:
options: keeping a watch over what is yours
preventing someone from having what you yourself don't use
questions.answer: preventing someone from having what you yourself don't use

questions.question:
She keeps me on my toes.

'To keep one on their toes' means:
options: be ready to dance and walk on your toes
be always ready to deal with anything that might happen
questions.answer: be always ready to deal with anything that might happen

questions.question:
Sudha hasn't been too well lately, but I think she is on the mend now.

'To be on the mend' means:
options: trying to be cheerful despite being ill

questions.question:
We feel that it was foolish of him to change horses in midstream.

'Change horses in midstream' means:
options: prefer a fresh horse that is not tired
make changes in an activity that has already begun
questions.answer: make changes in an activity that has already begun

questions.question:
He has been advised to mend his behaviour, but all that he has been told is just water off a duck's back.

'Water off a duck's back' means:
options: a duck which is completely dry
comments that have no effect on the listener
questions.answer: comments that have no effect on the listener

questions.question:
The family has lost most of their money, yet the members are working together to weather the storm.

'Weather the storm' means:
options: succeed in overcoming a difficult situation
succeed in keeping away from the storm
questions.answer: succeed in overcoming a difficult situation

subject: English E1
